'''Morality''' (from the [[Latin]] ''{{Lang|la|moralitas}}'' "manner, character, proper behavior") is the [[understanding|sense]] that differentiates among intentions, decisions, and [[Social actions|actions]] between those that are good (or right) and bad (or wrong). A ''moral code'' is a system of morality (for example, according to a particular [[philosophy]], [[religion]], [[culture]], etc.) and a ''moral'' is any one practice or teaching within a moral code. ''Immorality'' is the active opposition to morality, while ''amorality'' is variously defined as an unawareness of, indifference toward, or disbelief in any set of moral standards or principles.
+
'''Morality''' (from the [[Latin]] ''{{Lang|la|moralitas}}'' "manner, character, proper behavior") is the [[understanding|sense]] that differentiates among intentions, decisions, and [[Social actions|actions]] between those that are good (or right) and bad (or wrong). A ''moral code'' is a system of morality (for example, according to a particular [[philosophy]], [[religion]], [[culture]], etc.) and a ''moral'' is any one practice or teaching within a moral code. The adjective ''moral'' is synonymous "good" or "right." ''Immorality'' is the active opposition to what one believes to be moral (i.e. good or right), while ''amorality'' is variously defined as an unawareness of, indifference toward, or disbelief in any set of moral standards or principles.
